bibl.title: William W. Tinkham and Annie Ll. Tinkham v. David E. Kimble and A.B. Corriell. Order of discharge
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Justice Court of Mount Vernon Precinct County of Skagit, Territory of Washington

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE THIRD JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY, HOLDING TERMS AT SEATTLE FOR THE COUNTIES OF KING AND KITSAP.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF WILLIAM *ORDER W. TINKHAM FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS

NOW ON THIS 14TH DAY OF SEPTEMBER, 1887 ON PETITION OF WILLIAM W. TINKHAM FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS. AND THE SAID WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND THE RETURN THERETO OF JASPER GATES, DEPUTY CONSTABLE, COMING ON TO BE HEARD: AND THE SAID JASPER GATES APPEARING IN OPEN COURT WITH THE BODY OF WILLIAM W. TINKHAM. AND THE SAID JASPER GATES AND THE TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON APPEARING BY SAMUEL H. PILES, DEPUTY PROSECUTING ATTORNEY FOR THE DISTRICT, AND BY L.C. GILMAN; AND THE SAID JASPER GATES HAVING MADE RETURN THAT HE HELD THE BODY OF WILLIAM W. TINKHAM UNDER A COMMITTMENT ISSUED ON THE 2ND DAY OF SEPTEMBER, 1887, BY JOHN T. MASON, JUSTICE OF THE PEACE IN AND FOR SKAGIT COUNTY; AND THE COURT HAVING HEARD THE EVIDENCE AND ARGUMENTS OF COUNSEL; AND IT APPEARING TO THE COURT THAT THE SAID JUSTICE OF THE PEACE HAD NO JURISDICTION TO ENTER THE ORDER MADE BY HIM ON THE 2ND DAY OF SEPTEMBER, 1887. COMMITTING THE SAID WILLIAM W. TINKHAM UNTIL THE SUM OF $40.25 SHOULD BE PAID; AND THE SAID JUSTICE OF THE PEACE HAD NO JURISDICTION OR LEGAL AUTHORITY TO ISSUE THE SAID WARRANT OF COMMITTMENT, AND THE SAID WARRANT IS ILLEGAL AND VOID; AND THE SAID WILLIAM W. TINKHAM IS UNLAWFULLY RESTRAINED OF HIS LIBERTY, THEREFORE

IT IS CONSIDERED AND ADJUDGED THAT THE SAID WILLIAM W. TINKHAM BE, AND HE HEREBY IS DISCHARGED, AND HE MAY GO HENCE WITHOUT DAY. AND THAT THE COSTS OF HIS PROCEEDING BE PAID BY THE COUNTY OF SKAGET IN THIS TERRITORY.
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, }ss. COUNTY OF KING

I W.E. Ledgerwood Clerk of the District Court of the Third Judicial District, Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, in King County, for the counties of King and Kitsap, do hereby certify the foregoing, to be true, full and correct transcript of the order of discharge in the foregoing entitled cause, now on file, or of record in my office. Witness my hand and the Seal of the said Court, at Seattle, this the 14th day of Sept, A.D. 1887 W.E. Ledgerwood, Clerk
